ovdesc.p: This file is used within the Capital Reorganisation area of the Securities Module to identify the type of 'Capital Increase' being used within any particular transaction.
It therefore indicates whether the transaction involves the issuing of rights, the trading of rights or perhaps a straightforward new shares for old shares type transaction.

desc.p: This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the CAPITAL.INCREASE.TYPE in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered.
Examples:
Rights Issue
Bonus Issue
etc.
1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input).
Specifies whether rights are to be calculated within the Capital Increase Detail record or not.
This field specifies whether the Capital Increase is of the sort which issues Rights.
Y = Yes or N/NO = No only. (Mandatory input). Default Value = NO.
Specifies whether any Capital Increase transaction is to update the Original Security used or not.
Y = Yes or N/NO = No only. (Mandatory input.) Default Value = NO.

Fields WITH.RIGTHS and DEFAULT.TO.SEC.NO cannot be Y at the same time. For rights process, 2 transactions have to be entered, one for rights issue and another one for rights takeup. For rights issue, WITH.RIGHTS should be Y and DEFAULT.TO.SEC.NO should be NO. For rights takeup, WITH.RIGHTS should be NO, and DEFAULT.TO.SEC.NO should be Y.
Unique reference which identifies the CAPTL.INCREASE.TYP record.
1-5 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory input). Examples: RIGHTS - Rights Issue SCRIP - Scrip Issue
Used to store details of Original Capital Increase Type used within any particular Transaction.
Used for comparison lists of positions before and after.
1-5 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Optional input.)
This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the description of the CAPITAL. INCREASE.TYPE in various languages.
Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered.
1-15 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input).
A maximum of 2 characters may be entered.
The following values are permitted: Y NO
Specifies whether rights are involved with a particular Capital Increase Transaction.
Y = Yes or N/NO = No only. (Mandatory input.) Default Value = NO.

Fields WITH.RIGTHS and DEFAULT.TO.SEC.NO cannot be Y at the same time. For rights process, 2 transactions have to be entered, one for rights issue and another one for rights takeup. For rights issue, WITH.RIGHTS should be Y and DEFAULT.TO.SEC.NO should be NO. For rights takeup, WITH.RIGHTS should be NO, and DEFAULT.TO.SEC.NO should be Y.
Specifies whether Securities are to be posted to safecustody accounts or not.
The Capital Increase Type may be such that no actual postings are to be made to a client's safecustody Account. Merely a reference or a calculation facility.
Y = Yes or N/NO = No only. (Mandatory input.) Default Value = NO.
Specifies whether a Safecustody Account is to be credited or debited with a Capital Increase Type Transaction.
Used to inform the System of any Reverse Splits where it may need to debit the safecustody Account.
Y = Yes or N/NO = No only. (Mandatory input.) Default Value = NO.
Specifies whether a Safecustody Account is to be Debited or not with any particular Capital Increase type Transaction.
ACCOUNT.CREDIT and ACCOUNT.DEBIT can be utilised to cater for any different Capital Increase Type Transaction.
Y = Yes or N/NO = No only. (Mandatory input.) Default Value = NO.
Specifies which format print is to be used to print the advices.

The value you specify should point to a particular record on the DE.FORMAT.PRINT file for those advice types which relate to capital restructuring activities. These are located under advice type 1510.

You should ensure that the format you wish to use exists as this cannot be validated at this point. For example, if the above two records only existed and version 3 was selected then NO advice would be created by the delivery system.
This field will be defaulted into field ADVICE.PRINT.FLAG on the CAPTL.INCREASE.CUS record.
1-5 numeric characters. (Optional input.)
Specifies whether the System is to calculate the subscription details or not for any particular Capital Increase Transaction.
Y = Yes or N/NO = No only. (Mandatory input.) Default Value = NO.
